title: Adelaide CBD: Man seriously injured in apartment fall
text:
A man has been rushed to hospital after falling 10m to the ground while trying to scale down an apartment complex in the city.

The Advertiser understands the man, believed to be in his late 20s or early 30s, had been locked out of his Hocking Place apartment and used a cable or rope to try to access his second storey unit from the roof.

However, the cable snapped and he plunged to the ground just after 5am this morning.

A pool of blood could be seen on the ground below the apartment.

It is believed the man was taken by ambulance to the Royal Adelaide Hospital with serious injuries.

Another man also fell from an internal stairs landing.

His injuries are not known but he was not transferred to hospital and remained at the complex to recover.

Police attended the scene and deemed the incident not suspicious.

description: A man locked out of his CBD apartment has been seriously injured when the rope he used to scale the building snapped, plunging him 10 metres to the ground. Follow live news here.
